unnormalised: **Quora Post: Yoga Practices in Lifestyle & Wellness**
normalised: **Quora Post: Yoga Practices in Lifestyle and Wellness**

unnormalised: So, I’ve been getting a lot of questions about my yoga practice lately, and I thought I'd share a little about what works for me. Honestly, incorporating yoga has been a game-changer for my overall well-being.
normalised: So, I’ve been getting a lot of questions about my yoga practice lately, and I thought I'd share a little about what works for me. Honestly, incorporating yoga has been a game-changer for my overall well-being.

unnormalised: I started with simple Hatha yoga at a local studio near my house in Bandra. The instructor, a wonderful lady named Sunita Ji, really emphasized the importance of proper alignment. It's not about how far you can stretch, but *how* you stretch!
normalised: I started with simple Hatha yoga at a local studio near my house in Bandra. The instructor, a wonderful lady named Sunita Ji, really emphasized the importance of proper alignment. It's not about how far you can stretch, but *how* you stretch!

unnormalised: Now, I try to squeeze in at least 30 minutes every morning before the Mumbai madness begins. Some days it's just a few sun salutations (Surya Namaskar), other days I try a more challenging flow with poses like Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II) and Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana). I’ve even managed to dedicate a small 100 sq ft space in my apartment just for yoga and meditation.
normalised: Now, I try to squeeze in at least thirty minutes every morning before the Mumbai madness begins. Some days it's just a few sun salutations (Surya Namaskar), other days I try a more challenging flow with poses like Warrior two (Virabhadrasana two) and Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana). I’ve even managed to dedicate a small one hundred square feet space in my apartment just for yoga and meditation.

unnormalised: Apart from the physical benefits like increased flexibility and strength, I find it incredibly calming. It helps me manage stress, especially with my demanding job. Dr. Sharma, my family physician, even recommends yoga for stress management and lower back pain!
normalised: Apart from the physical benefits like increased flexibility and strength, I find it incredibly calming. It helps me manage stress, especially with my demanding job. Doctor Sharma, my family physician, even recommends yoga for stress management and lower back pain!

unnormalised: I also use the Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Centre's online resources sometimes for inspiration. Their approach to holistic health, combining asana, pranayama, and meditation, really resonates with me.
normalised: I also use the Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Centre's online resources sometimes for inspiration. Their approach to holistic health, combining asana, pranayama, and meditation, really resonates with me.

unnormalised: It’s definitely worth exploring if you're looking to improve your physical and mental health. Don't feel pressured to do complicated poses right away. Start slow, listen to your body, and maybe even find a good teacher. Remember, consistency is key. Even 15 minutes a day can make a big difference. My monthly studio fees are around Rs. 2500, which I think is a reasonable investment in my health.
